title: Tapestry: Winter
provenance_text:
Gobelins Tapestry Manufactory, Paris, France. King Louis-Philippe I [1773-1850], Paris, France, by 1850; Estate of King Louis-Philippe I, Paris, France, 1850 until January 1852; (sold at Maison d'Orleans, Paris, France, on January 28, 1852) [1]; purchased by George O. Hovey, Boston, MA, January 28, 1852 until sometime before 1898 [2]; Mrs. John T. Morse, his daughter, Boston, MA, 1906 until October 14, 1929 [3]; (sold at American Art Association-Anderson Galleries, New York, NY, November 22, 1929 until November 23, 1929) [4]. Lucien DeMotte? [5]. (French and Company, New York, NY, January 1931); purchased by William Randolph Hearst [1863-1951], October 1931 until 1951; Hearst Foundation, New York, NY, until 1954; gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, 1954. 
NOTES: [1] This sale is listed as being "Tapisseries Anciennes des Gobelins (XVI et XVII si√©cles) et autres et  Tapis  provenant de la succession de fue roi Louis-Philippe". This work was one of a group of three listed as number 15 on pages 11 and 12. [2] See correspondence from Museum of Fine Art, Boston from February 23, 1954 in curatorial file. This tapestry, along with 54.6.2, was on loan to MFA Boston "from the heirs of the late George O. Hovey" in 1898. The ownership of these tapestries was transfered to Mrs. John T. Morse, Jr. in 1906. [3] This tapestry was on loan at MFA Boston from 1899 until October 14, 1929. [4] See correspondence from October 9, 1975 in curatorial file for reference to this sale. [5] This name has also been recorded as "Lucian".
